name: disgracefully
content:

very badly, in a way that causes shame or a loss of respect: You've behaved disgracefully. He said that prisoners had been disgracefully abused. See
disgraceful
More examplesFewer examplesI found his comment to be disgracefully insulting.I think the media has acted disgracefully in this matter.He disgracefully attempted to blame his wife for his own error.They are disgracefully blocking a peace agreement.The world has remained disgracefully silent on this atrocity.Their tactics were disgracefully bad.
